STATEMENT OF THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTS OF THE NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES FOR THE FINANCIAL YEAR ENDED 30TH JUNE 1891.

REGINA:
PRINTED BY R. B. GORDON, PRINTER TO THE GOVERNMENT OF THE NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES.
1891.
STATEMENT
OF THE
PUBLIC ACCOUNTS
OF THE
NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES
FOR THE
FINANCIAL YEAR ENDED 30TH JUNE
1891.

REGINA:
PRINTED BY R. B. GORDON, PRINTER TO THE GOVERNMENT OF THE
NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES.
1891.
To His Honor the Lieutenant-Governor of the North-West Territories.

May it Please Your Honor,

I have the honor to submit the Public Accounts of the North-West Territories for the Financial Year ended 30th June, 1891.

I have the honor to be,

Sir,

Your obedient Servant,

L. O. BOURGET,

Accountant, N.W. Government.

Regina, December 1st, 1891.

AUDITOR'S REPORT.

ACCOUNTANT'S OFFICE,
NORTH-WEST GOVERNMENT,
REGINA, NOV. 30, 1891.

SIR,

In accordance with Your Honor's instructions, I beg to report that I have thoroughly examined the Books and Accounts of the North-West Government for the year ended 30th June, 1891, and found the same correct.

I append hereto a statement in tabular form of the Receipts and Expenditure of the Local Revenue Fund, showing Balance from last year to be $11,468.07; Receipts, $18,781.93; and Expenditure, $25,216.54; leaving a Balance on hand of $5,033.46.

I have much pleasure in testifying to the neatness of the Books, and to the efficiency of the various Officers in the Accountant's Department.

I have the honor to be,

Sir,

Your obedient servant,

HY. LEJEUNE,

Auditor.

His Honor the Lieutenant-Governor,
North-West Territories, Regina.
